content:
It sounds like you had a fantastic experience volunteering at the literary festival! Seeing the festival come together behind the scenes and meeting the passionate organizers must have been a great experience. It's wonderful that you felt proud to be a part of it.

Colson Whitehead's keynote speech sounds like it was truly inspiring and thought-provoking. His message about storytelling's power to humanize and give voice to marginalized communities is so important, especially in today's world. It's crucial that we continue to amplify diverse voices and perspectives through literature.

I love the quote you shared from his speech: "storytelling is a way of taking the chaos of the world and making sense of it." That resonates so deeply. Literature has the power to help us process and understand the complexities of the world, and to find meaning in the midst of chaos. It's a reminder of the importance of empathy, compassion, and understanding in our lives.

It's great that you were able to take away something meaningful from the speech. Did you have a chance to meet Colson Whitehead or get your book signed after the event?
